div.head: CHAP. XLI.
1 Gods care of the poore. 4 Dauid complaineth of his enemies trecherie. 10 He flyeth to God for succour.
div.ab: [To the chiefe Musician. A Psalme of Dauid.] Blessed is he that considereth the poore; the Lord will deliuer him in time of trouble. Or, the weake, or sicke. , Heb. in the day of euill.
The Lord will preserue him, and keepe him aliue, and he shall be blessed vpon the earth; and thou wilt not deliuer him vnto the will of his enemies. Or, doe not thou deliuer.
The Lord will strengthen him vpon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sicknesse. Heb. turne.
I sayd, Lord be mercifull vnto me, heale my soule, for I haue sinned against thee.
Mine enemies speake euill of me: when shall hee die, and his name perish?
And if hee come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquitie to it selfe, when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
All that hate me, whisper together against me; against me doe they deuise my hurt. Heb. euill to me.
An euill disease, say they, cleaueth fast vnto him; and now that he lyeth, he shall rise vp no more. Heb. a thing of Belial.
Yea mine owne familiar friend in whom I trusted, which did eate of my bread, hath lift vp his heele against me. Ioh.13.18 , Heb. the man of my peace. , Heb. magnified.
But thou, O Lord, be mercifull vnto mee, and raise me up vp that I may requite them.
By this I know that thou fauourest me: because mine enemie doeth not triumph ouer me.
And as for me, thou vpholdest me in mine integritie; and settest me before thy face for euer.
Blessed bee the Lord God of Israel, from euerlasting, and to euerlasting. Amen, and Amen.
